title: Workflow
text:
The following chart illustrates the workflow of this project, including sources of data, software/tools used in the analysis, storage locations of the produced research data and the output generated by us.
flowchart TD

    subgraph Resources
        RN1 --> RN5([Zotero Bibliography])
        RN1[(<br>Literature Research)] --->|Objects| RN3[Wikidata]
        
        RN2[("<br>Federal Register<br>of Buildings and Dwellings")] --->|Features| RN3

        DOC2 --> DOC4[Object Resources Collection]
        DOC3 -->|Records| DOC4
        DOC1[("<br>Survey (2024)")] -->|Photos| DOC2([Wikimedia Commons])
        DOC3[(<br>SBB Historic)] -. Photos .-> DOC2
        DOC5[(<br>YouTube,<br>Flickr, ...)] --->|Photos/Videos| DOC4

        DOC2 -->|Annotation| DOC2
    end

    subgraph Geodata
        direction LR
        RN6 -->|External Renderer| RN7([3D Models])
        RN6[OpenStreetMap] -->|OSMnx Download| RN8["Analysis<br> (Jupyter Notebook)"]
        RN8 -->|momepy Analysis| RN8

    end

    RN13 --> RN14
    RN3 <-->|Cross-Reference| RN6
    RN3 -->|Object Data| RN13
    RN8 -->|PDF<br>GeoJSON<br>Jupyter Notebook| RN9
    RN8 -->|Leaflet Map| CB2
    RN8 -->|Description| CB2


    subgraph Data Storage

        RN9["maxvogt-analysis <br>(GitHub Repository)"]
        RN9 -->|Quarto| RN11[Online<br>Documentation]
        RN9 --> RN10[Zenodo]


        RN14[CollectionBuilder] --> RN12["maxvogt <br>(GitHub Repository)"]
        RN13[Metadata CSV] --> RN12


        RN12 --> RN10


    end

    RN14 -->|Collection Items| CB2

    DOC4 --> RN13

    DOC1 --> RN6
    DOC1 --> RN3

    subgraph Presentation
        CB3([Poster])
        CB2([Website])        
    end

  style RN1 fill:#D9CCE3
  style RN2 fill:#D9CCE3
  style DOC1 fill:#D9CCE3
  style DOC2 fill:#F6C141
  style DOC3 fill:#D9CCE3
  style DOC4 fill:#7BAFDE
  style DOC5 fill:#D9CCE3
  style RN3 fill:#7BAFDE
  style RN5 fill:#F6C141
  style CB2 fill:#F6C141
  style RN6 fill:#7BAFDE
  style RN7 fill:#F6C141
  style RN8 fill:#90C987
  style RN10 fill:#F7F056
  style RN9 fill:#F7F056
  style RN12 fill:#F7F056
  style CB3 fill:#F7F056

title: Workflow
text:
Tools
The analysis is split up in Jupyter Notebooks that are available in this repository and can be launched either locally or using Binder.
The most important tool used for the spatial analysis is momepy1 by Martin Fleischmann and James Gaboardi. See the documentation for momepy examples and tutorials.
Geodata used for the analysis is retrieved from OpenStreetMap using the OSMnx2 package by Geoff Boeing. See readthedocs.io for documentation.

title: Workflow
text:
Footnotes


Fleischmann, M. (2019) ‘momepy: Urban Morphology Measuring Toolkit’, Journal of Open Source Software, 4(43), p. 1807. doi: 10.21105/joss.01807.↩︎
Boeing, G. (2024). Modeling and Analyzing Urban Networks and Amenities with OSMnx. Working paper. https://geoffboeing.com/publications/osmnx-paper/↩︎

title: Security Policy
text: To report a security issue, please email moritz.twente@unibas.ch with a description of the issue, the steps you took to create the issue, affected versions, and, if known, mitigations for the issue. This project follows a 90 day disclosure timeline.

title: maxvogt-analysis: Rümlang
text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following item of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - RUEM091
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Rümlang, Schweiz'
point = 47.45403, 8.53272
address = 'Bahnhofplatz 8–10, 8153 Rümlang'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
geopandas.tools.geocode(address).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Rümlang
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive_service', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Rümlang
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Rümlang
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rümlang/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rümlang/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rümlang/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rümlang/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rümlang/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Rümlang/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rümlang/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Rümlang
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rümlang/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Rümlang
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add RUEM091
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
ruem091 = Point(8.53272, 47.45403)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['ruem091'],
        'name': ['Station Building'],
        'constructed': ['1983']
    },
    geometry=[ruem091],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Rümlang.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

maxvogt-analysis: Zürich-Vorbahnhof
text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following items of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - ZVB009 - ZVB016 - ZVB017 - ZVB019 - ZVB022 - ZVB122 - ZVB222 - ZVB903
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Zürich, Schweiz'
point = 47.37982, 8.53112
address = 'Gustav-Gull-Platz 6, 8004 Zürich'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
#geopandas.tools.geocode(point).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Zürich-Vorbahnhof
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='bike', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Zürich-Vorbahnhof
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Zürich-Vorbahnhof
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Zürich-Vorbahnhof/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Zürich-Vorbahnhof/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Zürich-Vorbahnhof/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Zürich-Vorbahnhof/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Zürich-Vorbahnhof/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Zürich-Vorbahnhof/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Zürich-Vorbahnhof/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Zürich-Vorbahnhof
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Zürich-Vorbahnhof/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Zürich-Vorbahnhof
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)

    },
    geometry=[zvb017],
    crs='EPSG:4326'

# Convert to CH coordinate system

text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following items of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - ISL063
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Islikon'

address = 'Hauptstrasse 63, 8546 Islikon'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
#geopandas.tools.geocode(address).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Islikon TG
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)

buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)

buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

    osm_graph,

streets

streets

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Islikon/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Islikon/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Islikon/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Islikon TG
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Islikon/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Islikon TG
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add ISL063
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
isl063 = Point(8.84597, 47.54772)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['isl063'],
        'name': ['Auxiliary Building'],
        'constructed': ['1975']
    },
    geometry=[isl063],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Islikon TG
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Islikon.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following items of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - BSD080
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Bassersdorf'
point = 47.43862, 8.62621
address = 'Bahnhofstrasse 40, 8303 Bassersdorf'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
geopandas.tools.geocode(address).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Bassersdorf
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Bassersdorf
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Bassersdorf
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Bassersdorf/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Bassersdorf/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Bassersdorf/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Bassersdorf/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Bassersdorf/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Bassersdorf/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Bassersdorf/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Bassersdorf
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined

cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values

queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Sevelen/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Sevelen/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Sevelen/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Sevelen
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Sevelen/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Sevelen
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add SEV012
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
sev012 = Point(9.49382, 47.12524)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['sev012'],
        'name': ['Station Building'],
        'constructed': ['1961']
    },
    geometry=[sev012],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])


# Add SEV901
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
sev901 = Point(9.49394, 47.12482)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['sev901'],
        'name': ['Kiosk'],
        'constructed': ['1961']
    },
    geometry=[sev901],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Sevelen
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Sevelen.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following item of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - MTL055
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Marthalen'
point = 47.63494, 8.65327
address = 'Bahnhofstrass 1.1, 8460 Marthalen'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
#geopandas.tools.geocode(point).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Marthalen
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Marthalen
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Marthalen
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Marthalen/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Marthalen/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Marthalen/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Marthalen/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Marthalen/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Marthalen/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Marthalen/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame

plt.savefig('../results/Räterschen/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Räterschen/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Räterschen/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Räterschen/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Räterschen
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Räterschen/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Räterschen
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add RAET051
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
raet051 = Point(8.79535, 47.49858)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['raet051'],
        'name': ['Auxiliary Building'],
        'constructed': ['1970']
    },
    geometry=[raet051],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Räterschen
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Räterschen.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following items of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - MOER011
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Mörschwil, Schweiz'
point = 47.4747, 9.41445
address = 'Bahnhofstrasse 55, 9402 Mörschwil'
dist = 2000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
#geopandas.tools.geocode(place).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Mörschwil
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Mörschwil
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Mörschwil
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Mörschwil/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Mörschwil/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Mörschwil/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Mörschwil/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Mörschwil/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Mörschwil/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Mörschwil/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Mörschwil
text:

for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]

percentiles_joined

cgram.labels.head()

#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Koblenz/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Koblenz/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Koblenz/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Koblenz AG
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Koblenz/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Koblenz AG
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add KB050
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
kb050 = Point(8.22689, 47.60012)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['kb050'],
        'name': ['Service Building'],
        'constructed': ['1970']
    },
    geometry=[kb050],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Koblenz AG
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Koblenz.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')
