text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following items of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - RW061 - RW906
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Rapperswil SG'
point = 47.22504, 8.81749
address = 'Bahnhofplatz 6.1, 8640 Rapperswil SG'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
#geopandas.tools.geocode(point).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Rapperswil SG
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='bike', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Rapperswil SG
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Rapperswil SG
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rapperswil/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rapperswil/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rapperswil/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rapperswil/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rapperswil/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Rapperswil/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rapperswil/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Winkel/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Winkel/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Winkel/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Winkel/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Winkel am Zürichsee
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Winkel/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Winkel am Zürichsee
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add WIN032_a
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
win032_a = Point(8.59896, 47.29745)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['win032_a'],
        'name': ['Shelter Winkel (Platform 2)'],
        'constructed': ['1967']
    },
    geometry=[win032_a],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])


# Add WIN032_b
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
win032_b = Point(8.59862, 47.29764)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['win032_b'],
        'name': ['Shelter Winkel (Platform 1)'],
        'constructed': ['1967']
    },
    geometry=[win032_b],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Winkel am Zürichsee
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Winkel.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

maxvogt-analysis: Rekingen AG
text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following items of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - REK067 - REK167 (Station Fountain)
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Rekingen AG, Switzerland'
point = 47.56991, 8.32718
address = 'Bahnhofplatz 1, 5332 Rekingen AG'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
geopandas.tools.geocode(address).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Rekingen AG
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive_service', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Rekingen AG
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Rekingen AG
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rekingen/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rekingen/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rekingen/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rekingen/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rekingen/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Rekingen/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rekingen/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Rekingen AG
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Rekingen/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Rekingen AG
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)

# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['rek067'],
        'name': ['Station Building'],
        'constructed': ['1976']
    },
    geometry=[rek067],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
rek167 = Point(8.32744, 47.56984)  # (East, North)

    {

ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Uster/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Uster/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Uster/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Uster/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Uster/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Uster/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Uster
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Uster/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Uster
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add UST094
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
ust094 = Point(8.51056, 47.47039)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['ust094'],
        'name': ['Railway Goods Shed/Apartment Building'],
        'constructed': ['1984']
    },
    geometry=[ust094],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Uster
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Uster.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following items of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - AU083
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Au ZH, Schweiz'
point = 47.246789, 8.643639
address = 'Seestrasse 314, 8804 Au ZH'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
geopandas.tools.geocode(address).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Au ZH
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive_service', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Au ZH
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Au ZH

Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Au/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Au/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Au/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series

fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Au/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series

streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Au/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()

Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})

merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Uerikon/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Uerikon/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Uerikon/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Uerikon/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Uerikon
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Uerikon/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Uerikon
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add UER020
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
uer020 = Point(8.75281, 47.2359)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['uer020'],
        'name': ['Service Building'],
        'constructed': ['1965']
    },
    geometry=[uer020],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Uerikon
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Uerikon.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following items of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - HI007 - HI098 (Former Station Fountain)
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Hinwil, Switzerland'
point = 47.29986, 8.84002
address = 'Bahnhofplatz 1, 8340 Hinwil'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
#geopandas.tools.geocode(place).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Hinwil
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Hinwil
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Hinwil
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Hinwil/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Hinwil/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Hinwil/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Hinwil/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series

#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Hinwil/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Hinwil/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Hinwil/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Wetzikon/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Wetzikon/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Wetzikon/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Wetzikon/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Wetzikon
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Wetzikon/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Wetzikon
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add WZ088
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
wz088 = Point(8.79216, 47.31732)  # (East, North)
    
# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['wz088'],
        'name': ['Railway Supervision Service Building'],
        'constructed': ['1982']
    },
    geometry=[wz088],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])


# Add WZ095
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
wz095 = Point(8.79216, 47.31732)  # (East, North)
    
# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['wz095'],
        'name': ['Railway Goods Shed'],
        'constructed': ['1984']
    },
    geometry=[wz095],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Wetzikon
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Wetzikon.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.

This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following item of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - KN035
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Kempten ZH'
point = 47.33176, 8.80458
address = 'bei Stationsstrasse 19, 8623 Wetzikon ZH'
dist = 2000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
#geopandas.tools.geocode(place).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Kempten ZH
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Kempten ZH
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Kempten ZH
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Kempten/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Kempten/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Kempten/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Kempten/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Kempten/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Kempten/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Kempten/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Wattwil/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Wattwil/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Wattwil/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Wattwil/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Wattwil
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Wattwil/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Wattwil
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add WA045
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
wa045 = Point(9.0863, 47.29977)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['wa045'],
        'name': ['Service Building Express Restaurant'],
        'constructed': ['1969']
    },
    geometry=[wa045],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Wattwil
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Wattwil.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Wattwil
maxvogt-analysis

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text:
We as members, contributors, and leaders pledge to make participation in our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, visible or invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.
We pledge to act and interact in ways that contribute to an open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, and healthy community.



Examples of behavior that contributes to a positive environment for our community include:

Demonstrating empathy and kindness toward other people
Being respectful of differing opinions, viewpoints, and experiences
Giving and gracefully accepting constructive feedback
Accepting responsibility and apologizing to those affected by our mistakes, and learning from the experience
Focusing on what is best not just for us as individuals, but for the overall community

Examples of unacceptable behavior include:

The use of sexualized language or imagery, and sexual attention or advances of any kind
Trolling, insulting or derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks
Public or private harassment
Publishing others’ private information, such as a physical or email address, without their explicit permission
Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a professional setting




Community leaders are responsible for clarifying and enforcing our standards of acceptable behavior and will take appropriate and fair corrective action in response to any behavior that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, or harmful.
Community leaders have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, and other contributions that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, and will communicate reasons for moderation decisions when appropriate.



This Code of Conduct applies within all community spaces, and also applies when an individual is officially representing the community in public spaces. Examples of representing our community include using an official e-mail address, posting via an official social media account, or acting as an appointed representative at an online or offline event.



Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported to the community leaders responsible for enforcement at moritz.twente@unibas.ch. All complaints will be reviewed and investigated promptly and fairly.
All community leaders are obligated to respect the privacy and security of the reporter of any incident.



Community leaders will follow these Community Impact Guidelines in determining the consequences for any action they deem in violation of this Code of Conduct:


Community Impact: Use of inappropriate language or other behavior deemed unprofessional or unwelcome in the community.
Consequence: A private, written warning from community leaders, providing clarity around the nature of the violation and an explanation of why the behavior was inappropriate. A public apology may be requested.



Community Impact: A violation through a single incident or series of actions.
Consequence: A warning with consequences for continued behavior. No interaction with the people involved, including unsolicited interaction with those enforcing the Code of Conduct, for a specified period of time. This includes avoiding interactions in community spaces as well as external channels like social media. Violating these terms may lead to a temporary or permanent ban.



Community Impact: A serious violation of community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior.
Consequence: A temporary ban from any sort of interaction or public communication with the community for a specified period of time. No public or private interaction with the people involved, including unsolicited interaction with those enforcing the Code of Conduct, is allowed during this period. Violating these terms may lead to a permanent ban.



Community Impact: Demonstrating a pattern of violation of community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment of an individual, or aggression toward or disparagement of classes of individuals.
Consequence: A permanent ban from any sort of public interaction within the community.




This Code of Conduct is adapted from the Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available at https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html.
Community Impact Guidelines were inspired by Mozilla’s code of conduct enforcement ladder.
For answers to common questions about this code of conduct, see the FAQ at https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations are available at https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.
