title: maxvogt-analysis
text:
This repository contains data for spatial analyses that are part of a research project on spatial/urban design features of railway-related built structures designed by the Swiss architect Max Vogt. The data in this repository is openly available to everyone and is intended to support reproducible research.
Results of the analyses are accessible in an online collection of Vogt’s buildings and presented as a poster at the Spatial Humanities 2024 conference at the University of Bamberg.
         


The structure of this repository is based on the Open Research Data Template by @maehr, follows the Advanced Structure for Data Analysis of The Turing Way and is organized as follows:

analysis/: notebooks used to retrieve and analyze the data
assets/: images, logos, etc. used in the README and other documentation
data/: data files
docs/: documentation for the data and the repository
results/: geodata output of the analysis notebooks

Additionally, there is a Zotero group library with a collection of scientific articles and news reports that are of relevance for this project.



See Workflow for a description of the project workflow and the data obtained for this project.



To run the analysis locally, create a new conda environment based on the environment.yml file.
conda env create -f environment.yml
Activate the environment.
conda activate maxvogt
Open the Jupyter Notebook platform.
jupyter notebook
Pick a notebook from analysis/ to start the spatial analysis for one of Max Vogt’s buildings.



These data are openly available to everyone and can be used for any research or educational purpose. If you use this data in your research, please cite as specified in CITATION.cff. The following citation formats are also available through Zenodo:

BibTeX
CSL
DataCite
Dublin Core
DCAT
JSON
JSON-LD
GeoJSON
MARCXML

Zenodo provides an API (REST & OAI-PMH) to access the data. For example, the following command will return the metadata for the most recent version of the data

title: maxvogt-analysis
text:
The structure of this repository is based on the Open Research Data Template by @maehr, follows the Advanced Structure for Data Analysis of The Turing Way and is organized as follows:

analysis/: notebooks used to retrieve and analyze the data
assets/: images, logos, etc. used in the README and other documentation
data/: data files
docs/: documentation for the data and the repository
results/: geodata output of the analysis notebooks

Additionally, there is a Zotero group library with a collection of scientific articles and news reports that are of relevance for this project.

title: maxvogt-analysis
text: See Workflow for a description of the project workflow and the data obtained for this project.

title: maxvogt-analysis
text:
To run the analysis locally, create a new conda environment based on the environment.yml file.
conda env create -f environment.yml
Activate the environment.
conda activate maxvogt
Open the Jupyter Notebook platform.
jupyter notebook
Pick a notebook from analysis/ to start the spatial analysis for one of Max Vogt’s buildings.

title: maxvogt-analysis: Feldbach
text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following items of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - FB023
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Feldbach, Schweiz'
point = 47.23927, 8.78385
address = 'Bahnhofstrasse 16, 8714 Feldbach'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
geopandas.tools.geocode(address).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Feldbach
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Feldbach
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Feldbach
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Feldbach/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Feldbach/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Feldbach/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Feldbach/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Feldbach/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Feldbach/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Feldbach/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Feldbach
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Feldbach/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Feldbach
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add FB023
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
fb023 = Point(8.78385, 47.23927)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['fb023'],
        'name': ['Service Building'],
        'constructed': ['1966']
    },
    geometry=[fb023],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Feldbach
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Feldbach.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Feldbach

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

text:

buildings["area"] = buildings.area

streets["length"] = streets.length

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series

fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Uetikon/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Uetikon/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Uetikon/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Uetikon
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Uetikon/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Uetikon
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add UET030
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
uet030 = Point(8.67916, 47.25902)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['uet030'],
        'name': ['Service Building'],
        'constructed': ['1967']
    },
    geometry=[uet030],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])


# Add UET130
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
uet130 = Point(8.679216, 47.259125)  # (East, North)
    
# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['uet130'],
        'name': ['Station Fountain'],
        'constructed': ['1967']
    },
    geometry=[uet130],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Uetikon
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Uetikon.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following item of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - WSEE015
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Seen, Winterthur'
#place = 'Winterthur'
point = 47.48725, 8.76685
address = 'Kanzleistrasse 60.1, 8405 Winterthur'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
#geopandas.tools.geocode(place).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Winterthur-Seen
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive_service', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive_service', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive_service', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Winterthur-Seen
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Winterthur-Seen
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Seen/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Seen/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Seen/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Seen/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Seen/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Seen/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Seen/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Winterthur-Seen
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Seen/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Winterthur-Seen
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add WSEE015
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
wsee015 = Point(8.76685, 47.48725)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['wsee015'],
        'name': ['Service Building'],
        'constructed': ['1963']
    },
    geometry=[wsee015],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Seen.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

Streets

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)

streets

Generated data

Tessellation

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series

streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Stein-Säckingen/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Stein-Säckingen/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Stein-Säckingen/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Stein-Säckingen
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Stein-Säckingen/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Stein-Säckingen
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add STS044
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
sts044 = Point(7.94892, 47.54164)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['sts044'],
        'name': ['Station Building/Railway Goods Shed'],
        'constructed': ['1969']
    },
    geometry=[sts044],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Stein-Säckingen
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Stein-Säckingen.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following item of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - DTL052
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Dietlikon'
point = 47.42018, 8.6192
address = 'Bahnhofstrasse 30–32, 8305 Dietlikon'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
#geopandas.tools.geocode(point).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Dietlikon
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Dietlikon
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Dietlikon
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Dietlikon/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Dietlikon/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Dietlikon/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Dietlikon/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Dietlikon/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Dietlikon/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Dietlikon/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Dietlikon
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]

percentiles_joined

text:

How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')

    {
        'uID': ['dtl052'],

    },

    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Ziegelbrücke/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Ziegelbrücke/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Ziegelbrücke/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Ziegelbrücke
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Ziegelbrücke/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Ziegelbrücke
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add ZB024
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
zb024 = Point(9.06104, 47.13548)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['zb024'],
        'name': ['Employee Housing'],
        'constructed': ['1966']
    },
    geometry=[zb024],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])


# Add ZB089
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
zb089 = Point(9.06498, 47.13352)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['zb089'],
        'name': ['Substation Building'],
        'constructed': ['1982']
    },
    geometry=[zb089],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Ziegelbrücke
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Ziegelbrücke.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

maxvogt-analysis: Horgen
text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following item of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - HG002
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Horgen'
point = 47.26175, 8.5949
address = 'Seestrasse 117, 8810 Horgen'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
geopandas.tools.geocode(place).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Horgen
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Horgen
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Horgen
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Horgen/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Horgen/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Horgen/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Horgen/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Horgen/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Horgen/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Horgen/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Horgen
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()

text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)

# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
hg002 = Point(8.5949, 47.26175)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['hg002'],
        'name': ['Railway Goods Shed'],
        'constructed': ['1959']
    },
    geometry=[hg002],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Weesen/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Weesen/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Weesen
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Weesen/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Weesen
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add WN046
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
wn046 = Point(9.09462, 47.12996)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['wn046'],
        'name': ['Station Building/Railway Goods Shed'],
        'constructed': ['1969']
    },
    geometry=[wn046],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Weesen
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Weesen.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following items of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - LQ064
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Landquart'
point = 46.95685, 9.55655
address = 'Weststrasse 15, 7302 Landquart'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
geopandas.tools.geocode(address).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Landquart
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Landquart
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Landquart
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Landquart/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Landquart/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Landquart/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Landquart/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Landquart/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Landquart/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Landquart/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Weinfelden/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Weinfelden
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Weinfelden/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Weinfelden
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add WF054
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
wf054 = Point(9.10589, 47.56648)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['wf054'],
        'name': ['Auxiliary Building'],
        'constructed': ['1971']
    },
    geometry=[wf054],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Weinfelden
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Weinfelden.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')
