maxvogt-analysis: Wila
text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following items of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - WILA003
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Wila, Switzerland'
point = 47.41762, 8.84864
address = 'Stationsstrasse 13.1, 8492 Wila'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
#geopandas.tools.geocode(point).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Wila
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='bike', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='bike', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive_service', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Wila
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Wila
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Wila/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Wila/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Wila/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Wila/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Wila/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Wila/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Wila/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]

cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()

urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)

wila003 = Point(8.84864, 47.41762)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')

    {
        'uID': ['wila003'],
        'name': ['Auxiliary Building'],
        'constructed': ['1959']
    },
    geometry=[wila003],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Bülach
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Bülach/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Bülach
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add BUE081
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
bue081 = Point(8.55892, 47.43086)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['bue081'],
        'name': ['Remote Control Center Service Building'],
        'constructed': ['1980']
    },
    geometry=[bue081],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Bülach
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Bülach.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

maxvogt-analysis: Thalwil
text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following items of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - TW014 - TW059
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Thalwil'
point = 47.29601, 8.56483
address = 'Bahnhofstrasse 21, 8800 Thalwil'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
geopandas.tools.geocode(address).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Thalwil
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Thalwil
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Thalwil
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Thalwil/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Thalwil/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Thalwil/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Thalwil/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Thalwil/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Thalwil/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Thalwil/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]

percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)

cgram.labels.head()

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: St. Margrethen
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/St-Margrethen/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: St. Margrethen
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add SMG036
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
smg036 = Point(9.64106, 47.4526)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['smg036'],
        'name': ['Service Building Customs Veterinary'],
        'constructed': ['1968']
    },
    geometry=[smg036],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: St. Margrethen
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/St-Margrethen.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following items of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - ERLB027
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Erlenbach ZH'
point = 47.30576, 8.59146
address = 'Bahnhofstrasse 28, 8703 Erlenbach ZH'
dist = 2000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
geopandas.tools.geocode(address).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Erlenbach
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive_service', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Erlenbach
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Erlenbach
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Erlenbach/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Erlenbach/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Erlenbach/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Erlenbach/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Erlenbach/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Erlenbach/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Erlenbach/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Erlenbach

for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

title: maxvogt-analysis: Erlenbach
text:
Clustering

standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)

# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
erlb027 = Point(8.59146, 47.30576)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['erlb027'],
        'name': ['Station Building'],
        'constructed': ['1967']
    },
    geometry=[erlb027],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system

for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Küsnacht/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Küsnacht ZH
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add KUES028
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
kues028 = Point(8.58058, 47.31907)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['kues028'],
        'name': ['Station Building'],
        'constructed': ['1967']
    },
    geometry=[kues028],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Küsnacht ZH
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Küsnacht.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

maxvogt-analysis: Schwerzenbach
text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following items of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - SCWE096 - SCWE914
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Schwerzenbach, Schweiz'
point = 47.38441, 8.65873
address = 'Kaiserstuhlstrasse 25, 8154 Oberglatt ZH'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
geopandas.tools.geocode(address).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Schwerzenbach
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Schwerzenbach
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Schwerzenbach
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Schwerzenbach/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Schwerzenbach/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Schwerzenbach/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Schwerzenbach/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Schwerzenbach/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Schwerzenbach/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Schwerzenbach/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Schwerzenbach
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Schwerzenbach/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Schwerzenbach
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add SCWE096
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
scwe096 = Point(8.65873, 47.38441)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['scwe096'],
        'name': ['Station Building'],
        'constructed': ['1985']
    },
    geometry=[scwe096],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])


# Add SCWE914
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
scwe914 = Point(8.65743, 47.38513)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['scwe914'],
        'name': ['Railway Goods Shed'],
        'constructed': ['1984']
    },
    geometry=[scwe914],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Schwerzenbach.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Urdorf/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Urdorf ZH
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add URD097
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
urd097 = Point(8.4345, 47.39077)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['urd097'],
        'name': ['Auxiliary Building'],
        'constructed': ['1989']
    },
    geometry=[urd097],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Urdorf.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')

text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following items of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - SA092 - SA913
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Sargans, Schweiz'
point = 47.04489, 9.44615
address = 'Bahnhofplatz, 7320 Sargans'
dist = 1000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
#geopandas.tools.geocode(point).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Sargans
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='bike', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Sargans
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Sargans
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Sargans/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Sargans/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Sargans/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Sargans/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Sargans/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Sargans/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Sargans/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Sargans

for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Sargans/convexity.pdf')

standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)

    {

    },

    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame

    {
        'uID': ['sa913'],

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Oberrieden/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Oberrieden
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['ordd018'],
        'name': ['Station Building'],
        'constructed': ['1961']
    },
    geometry=[ordd018],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

text:
The code in this notebook is based on Martin Fleischmann’s 2021 workshop Capturing the Structure of Cities with Data Science (SDSC), licensed under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license. © 2021 Martin Fleischmann.
The geodata in this notebook is retrieved from OpenStreetMap. © OpenStreetMap Contributors.
This notebook contains geodata and analyses for the following item of the Max Vogt collection by Moritz Twente and Luisa Omonsky: - KLW049
Open in an interactive in-browser environment:
import warnings

import geopandas
import libpysal
import momepy
import osmnx
import pandas

from clustergram import Clustergram

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bokeh.io import output_notebook
from bokeh.plotting import show

from shapely.geometry import Point
Pick a place, ideally a town with a good coverage in OpenStreetMap and its local CRS.
place = 'Killwangen-Spreitenbach'
point = 47.43334, 8.35393
address = 'Bahnhofstrasse 17, 8956 Killwangen'
dist = 2000
local_crs = 'EPSG:2056'
#geopandas.tools.geocode(point).explore()

title: maxvogt-analysis: Killwangen-Spreitenbach
text:
Input data
Download data from OpenStreetMap.

Buildings

#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_place(place, tags={'building':True})
#buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_address(address, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)
buildings = osmnx.features.features_from_point(point, tags={'building':True}, dist=dist)


buildings


buildings.geom_type.value_counts()


buildings = buildings[buildings.geom_type == "Polygon"].reset_index(drop=True)


buildings = buildings[["geometry"]].to_crs(local_crs)


buildings["uID"] = range(len(buildings))


buildings



Streets
In comparison to Martin Fleischmann’s workshop, I here set truncate_by_edge to be True. Depending on the OSM mapping quality of the place at hand, it might also be necessary to change the value of network_type. See geopandas documentation for options.

#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_place(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True)
#osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_address(place, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)
osm_graph = osmnx.graph_from_point(point, network_type='drive', truncate_by_edge=True, dist=dist)


osm_graph = osmnx.projection.project_graph(osm_graph, to_crs=local_crs)


streets = osmnx.graph_to_gdfs(
    osm_graph, 
    nodes=False, 
    edges=True,
    node_geometry=False, 
    fill_edge_geometry=True
)


streets.explore()


streets


streets = momepy.remove_false_nodes(streets)
streets = streets[["geometry"]]
streets["nID"] = range(len(streets))


streets

title: maxvogt-analysis: Killwangen-Spreitenbach
text:
Generated data

Tessellation
We can generate a spatail unit using Voronoi tessellation with given building footprints.

limit = momepy.buffered_limit(buildings, 100)

tessellation = momepy.Tessellation(buildings, "uID", limit, verbose=False, segment=1)
tessellation = tessellation.tessellation



Link streets
Link unique IDs of streets to buildings and tessellation cells based on the nearest neighbor join.

buildings = buildings.sjoin_nearest(streets, max_distance=1000, how="left")


buildings


buildings = buildings.drop_duplicates("uID").drop(columns="index_right")


tessellation = tessellation.merge(buildings[['uID', 'nID']], on='uID', how='left')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Killwangen-Spreitenbach
text:
Measure
Measure individual morphometric characters.

Dimensions

buildings["area"] = buildings.area
tessellation["area"] = tessellation.area
streets["length"] = streets.length



Shape

buildings['eri'] = momepy.EquivalentRectangularIndex(buildings).series


buildings['elongation'] = momepy.Elongation(buildings).series


tessellation['convexity'] = momepy.Convexity(tessellation).series


streets["linearity"] = momepy.Linearity(streets).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("eri", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
buildings.plot("elongation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Building Equivalent\nRectangular Index', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Building Elongation', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Killwangen-Spreitenbach/eri_and_elongation.pdf')  


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("linearity", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Linearity', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Killwangen-Spreitenbach/convexity_and_linearity.pdf')  



Spatial distribution

buildings["shared_walls"] = momepy.SharedWallsRatio(buildings).series


buildings.plot("shared_walls", figsize=(12, 12), scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True).set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Killwangen-Spreitenbach/sharedwalls.pdf')  

Generate spatial weights matrix using libpysal.

queen_1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(tessellation, ids="uID", silence_warnings=True)


tessellation["neighbors"] = momepy.Neighbors(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", weighted=True, verbose=False).series
tessellation["covered_area"] = momepy.CoveredArea(tessellation, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series

with warnings.catch_warnings():
    warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
    
    buildings["neighbor_distance"] = momepy.NeighborDistance(buildings, queen_1, "uID", verbose=False).series


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

buildings.plot("neighbor_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
tessellation.plot("covered_area", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Neighbour Distance', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Covered Area', fontsize=20)


ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Killwangen-Spreitenbach/neighbourdist_and_coveredarea.pdf')  


queen_3 = momepy.sw_high(k=3, weights=queen_1)
buildings_q1 = libpysal.weights.contiguity.Queen.from_dataframe(buildings, silence_warnings=True)

buildings['interbuilding_distance'] = momepy.MeanInterbuildingDistance(buildings, queen_1, 'uID', queen_3, verbose=False).series
buildings['adjacency'] = momepy.BuildingAdjacency(buildings, queen_3, 'uID', buildings_q1, verbose=False).series


#fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))
#
#buildings.plot("interbuilding_distance", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#buildings.plot("adjacency", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
#
#ax[0].set_axis_off()
#ax[1].set_axis_off()


profile = momepy.StreetProfile(streets, buildings)
streets["width"] = profile.w
streets["width_deviation"] = profile.wd
streets["openness"] = profile.o


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

streets.plot("width", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("width_deviation", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
streets.plot("openness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Width', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Width Deviation', fontsize=20)
ax[2].set_title('Openness', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Killwangen-Spreitenbach/road_network.pdf')  



Intensity

tessellation['car'] = momepy.AreaRatio(tessellation, buildings, 'area', 'area', 'uID').series


tessellation.plot("car", figsize=(12, 12), vmin=0, vmax=1, legend=True).set_axis_off()
plt.title("Building/Tessellation Area Ratio")

plt.savefig('../results/Killwangen-Spreitenbach/tessellation_ratio.pdf')  



Connectivity

graph = momepy.gdf_to_nx(streets)


graph = momepy.node_degree(graph)
graph = momepy.closeness_centrality(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")
graph = momepy.meshedness(graph, radius=400, distance="mm_len")


nodes, streets = momepy.nx_to_gdf(graph)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(24, 12))

nodes.plot("degree", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)
nodes.plot("closeness", ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1, legend_kwds={"fmt": "{:.6f}"})
nodes.plot("meshedness", ax=ax[2], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True, markersize=1)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()
ax[2].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Killwangen-Spreitenbach/connectivity.pdf')  


buildings["nodeID"] = momepy.get_node_id(buildings, nodes, streets, "nodeID", "nID")

Link all data together (to tessellation cells or buildings).

tessellation


merged = tessellation.merge(buildings.drop(columns=['nID', 'geometry']), on='uID')
merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Killwangen-Spreitenbach
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Killwangen-Spreitenbach/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Killwangen-Spreitenbach
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add KLW049
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
klw049 = Point(8.35393, 47.43334)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['klw049'],
        'name': ['Station Building/Railway Goods Shed'],
        'constructed': ['1970']
    },
    geometry=[klw049],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame

merged = merged.merge(streets.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nID', how='left')
merged = merged.merge(nodes.drop(columns='geometry'), on='nodeID', how='left')


merged.columns

title: maxvogt-analysis: Stäfa
text:
Understanding the context
Measure first, second and third quartile of distribution of values within an area around each building.

percentiles = []
for column in merged.columns.drop(["uID", "nodeID", "nID", 'mm_len', 'node_start', 'node_end', "geometry"]):
    perc = momepy.Percentiles(merged, column, queen_3, "uID", verbose=False).frame
    perc.columns = [f"{column}_" + str(x) for x in perc.columns]
    percentiles.append(perc)


percentiles_joined = pandas.concat(percentiles, axis=1)


percentiles_joined


fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(24, 12))

tessellation.plot("convexity", ax=ax[0], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)
merged.plot(percentiles_joined['convexity_50'].values, ax=ax[1], scheme="natural_breaks", legend=True)

ax[0].set_title('Convexity', fontsize=20)
ax[1].set_title('Convexity_50', fontsize=20)

ax[0].set_axis_off()
ax[1].set_axis_off()

plt.savefig('../results/Stäfa/convexity.pdf')

title: maxvogt-analysis: Stäfa
text:
Clustering
Standardize values before clustering.

standardized = (percentiles_joined - percentiles_joined.mean()) / percentiles_joined.std()


standardized


How many clusters?

cgram = Clustergram(range(1, 12), n_init=10, random_state=0)
cgram.fit(standardized.fillna(0))


show(cgram.bokeh())


cgram.labels.head()


merged["cluster"] = cgram.labels[8].values


urban_types = buildings[["geometry", "uID"]].merge(merged[["uID", "cluster"]], on="uID")


urban_types.explore("cluster", categorical=True, prefer_canvas=True, tiles="CartoDB Positron", tooltip=False)


# Add STAE037
# Create new point geometries with the desired coordinates
stae037 = Point(8.72164, 47.24047)  # (East, North)

# Create a new GeoDataFrame for the point, adding the properties (like 'ID')
maxvogt_item = geopandas.GeoDataFrame(
    {
        'uID': ['stae037'],
        'name': ['Station Building'],
        'constructed': ['1968']
    },
    geometry=[stae037],
    crs='EPSG:4326'
)

# Convert to CH coordinate system
maxvogt_item = maxvogt_item.to_crs(local_crs)

# Append the new feature to the existing GeoDataFrame
urban_types = pandas.concat([urban_types, maxvogt_item])

title: maxvogt-analysis: Stäfa
text:
Export
Save cluster output geodata to geojson file:

urban_types.to_file('../data/raw/Stäfa.geojson', driver='GeoJSON')
